data.name: TextBox1.Text
data.value:
Lighting
Left clicking the mouse on the main display area positions the light. (if Dynamic Light is in effect it will be turned off) The Dynamic Light button (animated Sequences) Will cause the light to follow the mouse cursor around the screen. It will also pause any model rotation, lastly the cursor position text will turn yellow.
Right clicking on the main display will reset the light position to its default. (The Light uses the center of the display area as 0,0)
You can set the Z coordinate of the Light by either using the mouse scroll wheel when in the main display area or by adjusting the Z slider in the panel.
The button marked "s" or "S" toggles the way the light interacts with the surface of the model producing different effects.
The S slider increases or decreases the specularity of the object. The I slider controls the base strengh of the light for the object the R,G,B sliders add more light of the relevent colour.
The button labeled with a 'c' or a 'C' toggles the base material between a fixed colour (c) and a shaded colour scheme (C). This effects the colour of the model, not the light shining on it.

data.name: TextBox2.Text
data.value:
General controls
Backface Culling: When turned on does not draw polygons that are facing away from the camera. This speeds up rendering but can cause visual issues with the perspective camera and concave geometry.
Perspective: When on the camera takes its distance from the object into account and adds perspective distortion to the model. The P slider alters the distance between the camera and the object to increase or decrease the perspective effect. When off the camera renderes an orthographic view and moving it or the model on the Z axis will have no visible effect.
Transparency: The α checkbox toggles alpha blending (transparency) for the model on and off. The α slider controls the transparency of the object being viewed. α must be checked for the slider to take effect. How the transparency is applied can be changed from the menu.
Standard blending will render each polygon in the model as transperant. Post Render will take the rendered model and blend what is visible with the background.
Sliders: The slider controls are set up so most of them work best with the mouse wheel or the keyboard. Though Clicking and or Dragging works ok.
Keyboard : Arrow keys for small changes Page Up and Page Down for large changes
Background images: When checked the Bkg control will display an image in the background. (you need to load one from the menu first)
